newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore broker jailed for traffic cheating.
newsitem.headline: Singapore broker jailed for traffic cheating.

text.p: A Singapore broker who owns a Rolls-Royce, Mercedes-Benz and a Volvo, was jailed for two weeks and fined Singapore $800 (US$560) for cheating on a S$60 traffic licence, the Straits Times said on Friday.
The monthly licence is used to regulate traffic in the city centre and allows travel into the business district during the peak rush hour periods
Charlie Lau Suan Liat would have got away with his misdeed if not for a tip-off to the Land Transport Authority which proceeded to "ambush" him, the daily newspaper said.
Lau was charged with using a licence issued to another vehicle with the intention to deceive, and driving into the restricted zone without a valid licence, it said.
Cars are considered luxury items in the city-state and a top of the line Rolls-Royce costs up to S$1.5 million. ($=1.43 Singapore dollars)
